The most remarkable and the lengthiest production in the ‘Liber Veritatum’ is the dissertation or sermon on the seven streams ol Babylon, pp. 53-99. This is probably a concio ad clerum, a discourse addressed to the University, and is very instructive‚ not only as a specimen ol an elaborate fifteenth-century sermon, but as a statement ol the condition of the Church at the time in which it was composed.
